website_summaries.verdict: Pricey, but it can carry large loads securely, while using a lightweight frame.
pros: Consists of hollow aluminum materials, which deliver durability in a lightweight frame
Has a bracket to add a rear reflector or light
Attaches to many bikes securely with an easy installation process, but it won't fit certain bikes with disk brakes
cons: Mounting hardware included with this rack isn't of a high quality

customer_reviews.title: Great rack, but I deducted one star because the ...
customer_reviews.text: Great rack, but I deducted one star because the front mounting straps are chrome. My bike is black and the rack is black. The chrome straps really clashed. I had to paint the straps black. Some people probably would never notice something like that, but I did.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t mount because of a design flaw
customer_reviews.text: The design and feel of this bike rack was nice. Unfortunately the square outer geometry of the lower mount holes of the rack obstructed alignment with the mount holes on the bike and it could not be fastended as intended. Unclear why the designer went with square instead of round. Worse yet, this is Topeak’s only disc brake compatible rack. I returned it and the trunk bag and will have to select a competitor’s model. Too bad. The trunk bag was rather nice. 1 star, Topeak, for a nice bike rack that doesn’t fit because of a design flaw that has a seemingly simple correction.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Wild

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit Trek Verve 2
customer_reviews.text: The 1 star is more due to the measurements. Everything I read indicated this should fit my Trek Verve 2 but when I put it on the bike it didn't have enough clearance between the rack and the tire. If you are ordering for a Verve 2 then you probably need the 29er rack which should be slightly taller. I just ordered the 29er to see if that works better if not I'll be returning both. Disappointed that they don't have a way to adjust the height for clearance as I really liked this rack system to go with the bag. If the 29er won't work then the entire system will go back and I'll have to find another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Beachball

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, additional support brackets are hokey.
customer_reviews.text: Amazon or sent me the disc brake version, but handled the return quickly. The bike rack is perfect for my Priority Classic, my only gripe is the slotted universal brackets. I made my own out of aluminum tubing and it looks much better.
customer_reviews.author: Ken S.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't include all the parts you need
customer_reviews.text: This rack is 3 lbs so beware. The most disappointing aspect of this bike rack is the lack of mounting brackets. I saw a Youtube video on how to install this with hardware used in case you don't have holes in your seat stays. These brackets are missing from the product. So I had to go online and find what to use. I used something called "Portland Design Works Payload and Loading Dock Rack Hardware Pack" which did the trick. Here is a link:
customer_reviews.author: Jackson Roykirk

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, sturdy lightweight rack
customer_reviews.text: I bought the disk-brake version, it has extenders on the lower mounts to avoid hitting the disk brake rotor. The install was great, it's a very sturdy rack. Also easily adjustable to fit your bike. I gave it four stars rather than 5 because it's a little shorter length (front to back) than other racks. It does come with a mounting rail for bags etc, if you attached a bag on top it could compensate for the shorter length. I would definitely buy this again- it's a really good product, and a very good value.
customer_reviews.author: ITguy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Rack
customer_reviews.text: Bought in 2012, very satisfied with quality, fit and paint. Unit installed in about 20 minutes and works well with many brands of bags and panniers. Having dual hook points is nice when using with bungee cords. I zip-tied a tail light to the reflector mount. I used for year-round since I installed it. Until my bike got stolen, and I am very sad to lose it and my bike. I use this rack primarily for carry my backpack to go to school. I highly recommend this rack because it's sturdy and the MTX quick-click bags that work with it is beyond awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Tai P Hua

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, nicely adjustable, but larger than it needs to be
customer_reviews.text: This rack is exactly what I wanted (sturdy and adjustable to fit my new bike (Cannondale Quick Neo SL2)), except that its bottom attachment piece protects the bike's rear disc brakes with a clearance that I deem excessive and that makes installation a bit harder than it otherwise would be. Now that the rack's on, however, I know it will last as long as the bike, and that it can be transferred at least to this bike's successor and its successor's successor. As a result, I deem it a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: madamimadam

customer_reviews.title: Good choice (with a small wish)
customer_reviews.text: The rack construction is solid and easy to install. Size is excellent being neither too small nor too large. I really really wish the two aluminum colored bars that attach it to the frame below the seat post were black like the frame. My bike is black, the rack is black and the attaching "rods" are aluminum color. I'll likely paint the bars myself. Do not let the color effect your decision. This is a well made and nice fitting rack.
customer_reviews.author: The Rolling's

customer_reviews.title: Good bike rack
customer_reviews.text: Nice product. I bought one previously for my other bike and loved it. Since I ended up buying two Topeak bike rack cases (both are good), I decided to get the same rack for my other bike. Fits well and is easy to assemble. The case easily slides in and out. I've had the other one for 3-4 years and it's still going strong. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: S. Tomita

customer_reviews.title: More false claims.
customer_reviews.text: This did not fit on any of my bikes because it absolutely REQUIRES the width between braze-ons to either be a kids bike or road bike unless you want to hulk out on pulling the legs apart. Not to mention the clearance between my 26" wheels and the rack was too small to fit my finger. I'm not sure where Topeak learned their vocabulary, but this is so not what "universal" means.
customer_reviews.author: Lubbock

customer_reviews.title: Just barely fit 27.5" wheels with less than 1" clearance from bolt ends to tire.
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my wife's Trek mountain bike, size small, and it just barely cleared the tires. I think there is enough clearance (Almost 1 inch) for normal use, but obviously if she gets into mud it will pack up. Also, the straps were not long enough, so I had to use only a single bolt on each so the rack would not be tipped forward. In sum, it did not really fit this bike with 27.5" wheels without modification. On the positive side, the lower fittings for the disk brake mounts worked great. Also, I have a similar rack on another bike and really like the slide-on feature for Topeak bags.
customer_reviews.author: R. Ewers

customer_reviews.title: Needed the side clearance. Not sure I can use MTX office bag and panniers at same time.
customer_reviews.text: This fits my GT Backwoods Comp (Medium frame) 29er (which has disc brakes) well. I didn't really need the extra room for the disc brakes because the disc brakes on my bike are mounted low, but I did need the extra width this rack provides to get more clearance from between the sidewalls of the tire and the rack. I also bought the extra long mount arms (from todson.com) but didn't need them, the regular ones worked fine. Update: I ended up returning this and going with the Topeak Super Tourist (for disk brake bikes) and it allows me to use the MTX office bag and panniers at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Davison

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this rack on my ride for a while now, its stayed solid through an estimated 40 to 50 miles of bike-packing, and some jumps and hard trail sprinkled in there. All the welds are holding up well, its gained several scratches and dings from impacts now, but nothing that interferes with structural integrity yet. I love the rail system Topeak has designed. I use a couple different bags, and when I'm out checking trail cameras, the quick track system makes it a breeze to just unsnap and hike into the cameras with everything in a MTX bag. I have this rack installed on a Co-Op DRT 1.2. Had no issues installing over 27.5 inch wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Rockhopper

customer_reviews.title: Works great with the basket purchased separately
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the disk break option and my son installed it on his bike. It was a little tough to install and seemed barely big enough for his mountain bike tires, but works great. Plan to use a little patience installing. My son uses it with the basket sold separately to carry his fishing gear to and from the river. It carries his live bait minnow bucket really well and has room for snacks and a drink too. I am happy to have purchased this.
customer_reviews.author: sherry savage

customer_reviews.title: Great bike rack
customer_reviews.text: I installed this rack couple weeks ago and so far so good. Super easy to install and just remember that the two metal hangers that help stabilize the track are meant to be bent once you screw it in. If you have this rack then I would recommend checking out other Topeak products that are MTX compatible as you might as well take advantage of it. I also bought a MTX Topeak bag which goes really great with this rack.
customer_reviews.author: Jawa

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Easy Installation, Excellent System
customer_reviews.text: Perfect bike rack! I bought this for my Giant Escape 2 (Medium), and it slid right into position. The matte black paint on this rack blends seamlessly with my matte black bike. I also bought with this bike the Topeak MTX Trunk Bag. Let me tell you—this rack system holds the bag very securely, and also smoothly releases the bag when it’s time. Easy to use, intuitive even. I can’t wait to get more out of this and try some more Topeak accessories that go with the rack. (Like the basket.)
customer_reviews.author: McDaniel Kelly

customer_reviews.title: works with my disk brakes gravel Raleigh bike
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy good quality aluminum rack, easy to fit. Not very light though, about 1.7 pounds. The distance between legs at the mounting point is around 6'', I had to carefully spread them to 7'' to fit my bike. It is a bit risky perhaps, but disk specific Explorer rack is too wide. Most other racks are either 5'' spread, or 8'' for disk bikes. Height is about 14'', easily clears 700c wheel with 40mm tire, because mounting eyelets are slightly above the axle. I purchased earlier another Explorer rack for 26'' MTB, for commuting, was perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: t.reviews

customer_reviews.title: A good, solid rear rack for my E bike
customer_reviews.text: A good, solid rear rack for my E bike. I’m happy I bought the version with the spring, and plan on getting one of Topeak’s trunk bags once the need arises. Attachment was a bit iffy, but zip ties work wonders. If you have difficulty screwing your rack to your bike, use a small bit of bike lube to make things much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Mike K

customer_reviews.title: works for me
customer_reviews.text: I ride a fixed gear bike, i had the necessary holes on the frame to be able to install. its pretty sturdy so far and I'm buying the bags and attachments as well. On my bike to holes in the frame were a little difficult to screw in because of paint but a lil push and it was great. I commute to and from work as well as most of my errands and its handled a fairly heavy load
customer_reviews.author: Karma

customer_reviews.title: A very solid rack that has held up well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rack over three years ago and it has performed well since. I have a Topeak MTX Trunk DXP bag on it, and the whole thing has worked out well. The rack has never loosened up, let alone broken, so I've been happy with it. And, yes, just like in the Topeak brochures, etc, I occasionally ride up to a store or house and slide off the bag so I can take it inside with me. Just like that.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: Nice Rack
customer_reviews.text: Installed easily on a Trek Verve 2 hybrid. Clearance to 700c 45mm tire was close due to the two adjustable mounting bars extending straight back under the rack. As a precaution after getting everything mounted properly I removed the rack and bent those bars 3/8" up at the rear so they contacted the underside of the rack. Very happy overall with the quality and installation.
customer_reviews.author: SEM

customer_reviews.title: Make sure it fits
customer_reviews.text: The rack is well made and it will do everything I want it to. However, it says it will fit 700c tires and it may, just not mine. I have a 2019 Trek Verve 3 with 700 x 45 tires and the rack did not fit with enough tire clearance. I called Topeak and they suggested I buy the rack for the 29er with disc brakes even though I don't have disc brakes. I haven't ordered it yet, I want to research it before I buy it and have to return it. Great rack, just wouldn't fit properly.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Golfer

customer_reviews.title: Do not use with child seat!
customer_reviews.text: Intended to use to hold a Hamax child seat but rack has printed on top of it not to use with child seat. This is not specified on the description of the product and the one that Topeak has for use with their child seats looks very much the same as this one. I don’t understand. I called Topeak and they told me the only rack “approved” for child seats is the one they sell with their seat. Lost a few bucks on restocking and shipping. Did not fit my needs but looked like a great rack.
customer_reviews.author: DJK

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy so far
customer_reviews.text: Installed on new Cannondale Trail 7 MTB. Should have returned it for the version without disc brake. It is not necessary on the Cannondale because if the way they mount the disc brakes on the frame. Had to spread the lower arms to fit the wide dropouts. Otherwise mounts and works fine so far. Need to add some thread lock so screws don’t loosen riding trails.
customer_reviews.author: bike rider

customer_reviews.title: Great rack... if you don't mind being locked into the Topeak MTX system
customer_reviews.text: Great bike rack. I've used it on both a rim brake bike and now a disc brake bike. If you are thinking of getting the disc brake model for a disc brake bike, try this rack first; sometimes you don't need the disc specific model for certain bikes (my Motobecane Strada CM Comp w/TRP Hy/Rd discs didn't need it for example). The MTX design means you have a great range of accessories from Topeak that attach easily to the rack... and nothing else. So think carefully; if the other Topeak rack accessories look good to you, then chances are you should be happy with this rack.
customer_reviews.author: Alex E II

customer_reviews.title: Overall, a good rack
customer_reviews.text: Installed this rack on a Specialized Sirrus 4.0 and the fit was spot on. There were several videos on the internet which demonstrated the installation process and they were somewhat helpful. It wasn't an easy installation, but it wasn't very difficult either.
customer_reviews.author: jrak

customer_reviews.title: Good Rack but Installation hardware not sufficient!
customer_reviews.text: After installation it looks fine. But during installation, i discovered that the nuts are not provided. The holes with threads on bike don't fit the fasteners provided from package. I had to use my own fasteners, since I don't want to return to Amazon. But in the end, I made it work!
customer_reviews.author: Bac Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Require additional part for XS or S women frames
customer_reviews.text: This rack is certainly built nice, sturdy and lightweight, but be warned that it is NOT an "any fit" system. If you have an extra small or small frame like mine, you will likely need a longer mounting bracket which costs an additional $10 sold separately. Link ->  . This will bring the cost to about $50. It's a premium price, but it will work.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Great Carrier with the Matching Basket
customer_reviews.text: My bike is a lean, mean shopping machine with my Topeak carrier and basket. The basket slides in and out of the secure track, and the cargo net completes the set for incredible cargo capacity. Highly recommended. I'm ready to buy my 3rd carrier, for a brand new bike.
customer_reviews.author: JLK

customer_reviews.title: Nice rack, after a little adaptation
customer_reviews.text: I'm pleased with the functionality and build quality of this rack. I did choose this model for the spring clip, which seems like a practical feature, but time will tell whether I was right. I dinged it one star only because the square lower mounting blocks were beefier than they appeared in the photo, so much as to impinge on the welds of the frame lugs and cause bending stress on the mounting bolts. To get the blocks to fit flush against the frame lugs, I had to grind down the lower front corners of both blocks. With that done, the fit is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: curiosity

customer_reviews.title: Excellent rack
customer_reviews.text: Love it. It's versatile. Either I can strap the pack to the top, strap something else to the top, or use the spring. Very easy to install. I had previously purchased the Blackburn but it would not install on my bike because I have V brakes and the rear brakes directly intersected with the bars that connect to seat tube. With the flexible bars on this model that problem is avoided. It's also pretty darn light for a rack.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Messinger

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product
customer_reviews.text: Great product when used w/ the Topeak paneer bag. Bag just slides in and locks! And you'll know when your bag locks in, it makes a nice loud 'click'. I pound over rough terrain & large gravel, always forgeting it's there! You can't feel it. I really can't believe we've been cycling for 20 yr's and never thought to get this! Will be outfitting my kids bikes w/ these as well. And those bags hold a ton! I love them when I need to carry jackets/ and use them when shopping at yard sales. Hubby installed the 2 racks we bought quickly & effortlessly.
customer_reviews.author: busy mom

customer_reviews.title: Bent and broke
customer_reviews.text: This rack lasted about a year before it bent and broke. So far I have seen at least one other reviewer who had the same problem. I typically used it to hang a 4-lb U lock on one side, and a pannier bag generally with about 6-7 lbs of stuff in it on the other. On one morning commute I noticed one side of the rack was hanging loose (on the U lock side). I thought maybe I lost a screw, but it turned out that the L-shaped lower bracket mount was severely bent and the screw had actually snapped in half! I expected this rack to perform much better. Too low quality aluminum maybe?
customer_reviews.author: wkspeer

customer_reviews.title: Fits Specialized Rockhopper 29er Medium Frame Without Issue.  Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Installation was around 30 minutes on a '14 Specialized Rockhopper 29, medium frame with disc brakes. Works exactly as I'd hoped, and exactly as described. High quality stainless steel attachment hardware (including the rails that attach to the thread seat-stay bosses). When installed those rails are bent down to form a surprisingly tight arc, so they're not straight as the installation documentation suggests, but they stay in place without issues. My one complaint is that I cannot a reasonably price rear light kit (or adapter) to fit on the back of the rack, but that could just be my poorly-conducted search.
customer_reviews.author: artvarck

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic and Lightweight!
customer_reviews.text: This rack is very lightweight and attaches very easily. The installation and mounting was very straightforward on my single gear. Unfortunately, my bike didn't have the correct mounting setup, so I had to buy some c-clamps at the hardware store to attach the rack (I don't consider this as a negative as it's more of a point against my bike). It added little-to-no-weight to my bike, which is great! I really enjoy that it's solid underneath so that it also functions as a back fender to prevent nasty splatter during rainy rides.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel S.

customer_reviews.title: Very strong, needs more screw length options
customer_reviews.text: If you added in another set of silver support straps that were a few inches longer you could cover more bikes. Mine is maxed out. Still fits, very strong. I have transported around 20 lbs on it so far. Did not even flinch. Like the other reviews say, plan on heading to the hardware store for different bolts. The ones they sent were too short for the lower mount.
customer_reviews.author: David Thomsen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the Specialized Vita Women's Bike (or other smaller bike frames!)
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this rack specifically for my new Specialized Vita bike. I am 5'3" therefore my bike frame is pretty small. Other frames I had purchased that said they fit small bikes did not work. I found others who had my bike and wanted a bike rack state that this specific model was the one they found that would fit. I took this rack to my local bike shop to install since I didn't trust myself drilling into the frame of my new bike. Though it did look quite easy to install if you know what you are doing. It seems to be holding up pretty well when I use my paneers.
customer_reviews.author: mplsmaven

customer_reviews.title: does not take the baby seat
customer_reviews.text: I have a 26" x 4" fatbike I bought this for, but i was sad to realize after I got it mounted that it was not able to take the child seat. This wasn't mentioned anywhere in the description. It also doesn't come with the extra long attachment bars, which are so cheap to produce that I can't believe they didn't come with the rack.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Gaddis

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Time and Resources
customer_reviews.text: ordered this rack twice: once in August 2017, all fine, great rack. would have been a 5 star product. Second order in October 2017: this time did not include the steel mounting brackets. Without them, the rack is useless. There was no easy way to request the brackets: product was shipped from "Amazon Deals Online". Could not see a way to get in contact or ask for the brackets, hence, I send everything back. Waste of time and resources. Will order from other Topeak retailer. For once, Amazon failed me.
customer_reviews.author: Peter P

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: Second one of these this week. First went on my gf's hybrid, also positive Easy install, super solid. Mine is current installed on a cross/adventure/battering ram bike. Looks legit. It's since received a fair amount of use; thus far no concerns. One thing in particular that's nice is its low(er) profile. Most traditional touring racks are set up such that they extend out (heel clearance, etc) making for a larger rack overall. While this is ok, t's maybe not entirely necessary when commuting or on lighter shorter tours. The explorer is takes up minimal space. Set and forget it.
customer_reviews.author: allonespeed

customer_reviews.title: delivered early and installation was a breeze
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my trek 7500 hybrid 700C and the estimated delivery date was two weeks out but was handled by the USPS and was delivered within 5 business days. The notifications I got via USPS were specific to a two hour time window which is much better than the normal Amazon experience using their delivery or fedex/ups. The rack had all the parts I needed plus one extra washer and I had to spend a little time getting it adjusted to be level but no modifications or extra parts were needed so I perfectly satisfied with the experience.
customer_reviews.author: chris v

customer_reviews.title: Love this rack
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased two of these racks so far because of the quality. arrived fast thanks to Amazon Prime shipping and installed quickly on the bike. These racks are really rugged, they are designed to be tools and not just a stamped piece of sheet medal. You can really put some cargo on this rack, it's designed to take some abuse. They sell additional models of this rack so you can purchase one with spacers that are designed for bikes with disc brakes and they even have a 29er model which I have that has extended arms for 29" tires and also includes spacers for disc brakes. Very well made
customer_reviews.author: OldthorTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly, great quality rack.
customer_reviews.text: I own the Topeak rear bag with the slide-on mounting system. It's awesome. So now I have the matching rack on both of my bikes so I can simply switch the bag from one bike to the other. Buying the second rack was cheaper than buying a second rear bag. Now I don't have to move my gear from bag to bag, because my bag fits both of my bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install. Looks great. Does its job.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mainly to be able to attach a rack-mounted child carrier on my bike. I was on the fence about whether I needed the spring-loaded version and finally decided to get it "just in case." I'm so glad I did. I've found it to be extremely useful and much easier than bungie strapping things onto my wife's traditional rack. I couldn't be happier with this purchase unless it were a few bucks cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M

customer_reviews.title: Very nice design but support straps for larger bikes are not included.
customer_reviews.text: Would have been a higher rayinh. Very aggravating the support straps supplied are too short for 29r bikes. Even worse you have to order (and wait...) them separately for $10. It would have cost less than a dollar to include them with the rack.
customer_reviews.author: Stknowhere

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, easily mountable and way more practical than ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice product, easily mountable and way more practical than the EX and RX seat post racks which have limited capacity. Plus, the MTX system is a nice touch. For those who dont knwo the different MTX (EX) systems are a little larger than the RX which are meant for road use and have a bit more capacity. Unless you're riding road, the MTX system is the way to go. Plus more bag styles are offered on the MTX systems
customer_reviews.author: randumtasx

customer_reviews.title: Topeak quality again, get this one, why get some bolt together copy, your bike deserves better than that.
customer_reviews.text: There are lots of choices, so look carefully, check the specs of each. Go with a reputable brand, it's important. Take a look at the picture of this rack, it is welded together - the way it should be. All the cheapies come in three pieces, so you bolt them together, it just bugs me the way they look, plus the bolts may get loose. Why do the cheapies come knocked down - so they can fit in a little box on their trip from you know where. This rack is one piece so it came in a large box, I am totally satisfied with it. Yes it cost more, but its worth it.
customer_reviews.author: StevenM

customer_reviews.title: Light, strong rack
customer_reviews.text: Great rack. Fits this bag perfectly: Topeak MTX Trunk Bag EXP Bicycle Trunk Bag with Rigid Molded Panels  Light and won't rust. The brackets were a slight pain, but they're fine. Note: This rack is designed for the black plastic track on the bottom of Topeak bags. This rack ALSO fits the Topeak bags with the grey track on the bottom. Dunno why the guy at the bike shop tried to talk me down on this, especially when I showed him the perfect fit. "I won't warranty that", he said, but refused to say why, other than "It doesn't fit." Meanwhile, I'm swinging the rack and bag by the bag handle. It's not coming off, guy...
customer_reviews.author: Dave A

customer_reviews.title: Almost 5 stars.
customer_reviews.text: The square connection points on the support legs may be difficult to attach to your particular bike. I had to somewhat retrofit them for my Cannondale. I had to actually hack off a corner of the block to get them to line up flush with the holes on my bike. Not a huge deal but I'm somewhat puzzled why they wouldn't have made them round instead. The square design added width to the ends that interfered with the design of my bike. Otherwise, this is a nice, lightweight Bicycle Rack.
customer_reviews.author: David D.

customer_reviews.title: Mounting bracket arm.
customer_reviews.text: This is an expensive rack and it comes standard with a mounting bracket arm that is 26.5 cm. In the installation instructions it mentions that for small frame bikes an optional 34.5 cm mounting bracket can be purchased. It is available on amazon for an additional $10.00. I think that Topeak should supply this free of charge. Don’t buy this rack if you have a small frame bike. The clearance between the rack, the screws holding the bracket arm and the tires is also too close.
customer_reviews.author: DonSC

customer_reviews.title: Nice rack but the disk version may not be necessary on all bikes w/ disk
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this rack because my bike (GT Transeo 1.0) has disk brakes. I figured that since it had the disk brakes that I needed the Topeak Explorer rack disk brake version. This was not the case. You would only need this model if your disk calipers are mounted on top (above the rack attachment point). My caliper is mounted to the side so I could use the standard model. This switch just meant that the lower portion of the rack wouldn't stick out from the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Mark E.

customer_reviews.title: This rack saved my bike and it has been extremely useful for me for years
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I've had. The only reason why I had to replace the first is because One of those large Street sweeper machines that city workers use in downtown LA smashed into my bike and bent it. Otherwise I never had a crack and it lasts forever. Actually if I didn't have that rack on there my bike probably would've been completely done for. I used my bike as my car for basically seven years and this rack was a huge part of getting all my groceries and having my pets right on the back etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits 2015 Trek 7.2FX
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to install on my 2015 Trek 7.2fx. The rack has plenty of attachment points for bungies. The arms from the rack to the seat stay were easy to bend by just loose fitting the bolts then tightening everything down. The rear light bracket is rotated 180 degrees from the mount for my Planet Bike Rack Blinky 5. It still mounts very solidly but it just looks silly. I wish Topeak would expand its line of MTX bags and accessories. I love the concept but their lineup is limited. They do offer a replacement part for the basket that makes it easy to adapt other items to the rack, but it's not exactly ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: not applicatble for my bikes
customer_reviews.text: I have two bikes and it fit none of them. I have to use zip lock to keep it not dropping. The quality is not bad, but you definitely need to make sure it fit your bike, and unfortunately the information is not very well given to check the size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Functional rack
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Easy to hang on Ortlueb bags. After a year of use some of the screws had rust spots. Can resist a lot, in a bike accident it took a hit from a motorized scooter bending beyond repair, but protecting the rear wheel that suffered no damage. No hesitation to reorder a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Uwe Haller

customer_reviews.title: Excellent but wasn't easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I really wish they made the part near the bottom that bolts to the frame round instead of square. I had to sand it round to make it fit, otherwise my skewer got in the way. I don't think that material adds anything structurally. Otherwise an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Nate Nelles

customer_reviews.title: I love the Topeak system
customer_reviews.text: I love the Topeak system. I like the mid-sized bag I use with this rack. I can quickly slide the bag onto the rack for my commute, and take it off again, to take it inside, at the other end. I mounted this rack on my Crosstrail. I use a seat post mounted rack for my road bike. They both use the same latching system, so I simply transfer the bag from bike to bike.
customer_reviews.author: Cecil

customer_reviews.title: Fits Cannondale Trail 6
customer_reviews.text: Installed on Cannondale Trail 6 29'r with no problems, using the existing threaded lugs on the bike. The rack is well made and cleared disc brakes and wheel with room to spare. The only caveat is that the front bracket arms that connect to the seat stays require a significant amount of bending to fit. Someone without access to a metal-working vise might find this difficult.
customer_reviews.author: oldcrankophile

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy rear bike rack
customer_reviews.text: This is a very solidly-built bike rack, and the MTX mounting system is a helpful feature. If you're considering getting their wire or plastic basket to attach to this rack, I strongly recommend getting one of the baskets at the same time as the bike rack, so that you know if the basket will fit around your bike's saddle.
customer_reviews.author: AmazingAnt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bike rack designed for Topeak Bags
customer_reviews.text: Installed easily! No missing parts! High quality throughout! Well designed! Well manufactured! Had no problems installing it on a hand-built recumbent. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Bob L.

customer_reviews.title: Snug and Solid on my Bike
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my Trek 8.3 DS. I had a hard time finding a rear rack for my bike. I followed the directions for installation that were straight forward except for the part of having to bend the extension brackets per manufacturers directions to fasten to the frame. You can see in my side photos how the extensions are bent down. However, it worked out and it's solid to carry my bag. I would buy again. This rack is for bikes with disc brakes and they do make a different rack for bikes with caliper brakes.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Solid bike rack.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to carry a bag which will carry my drone. It works very well. I would suggest having a helper hold it as its installed, it will make it easier.
customer_reviews.author: crickett

customer_reviews.title: Says it works for both disk and non-disk bikes -- not true.
customer_reviews.text: Instructions say this rack is "universal", works for both disk and non-disk bikes. True for some disk brakes, but not others. And as we were moving, and didn't get around to fitting the rack until we settled, Amazon will no longer allow returns of this item. So, for us, this is now a $50 paperweight. Terrible customer experience, Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: David Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Excellent (with reservations)
customer_reviews.text: The unit with the spring is a terrific plus. Sturdy, lightweight. Lovely. My only quibbles are that i1) the flange to attach the rear light to is slightly bent and hence the light holder will not seat into the holes properly and 2) the struts for attaching the unit to the rear of the seat are not painted and are shiny metal. It creates a glaring contrast on my beautiful bike. Other than that I was told Topeak was the best and it seems fine
customer_reviews.author: Johdri

customer_reviews.title: Great product but not universal
customer_reviews.text: It works great but I had to improvise when installing. The options were to return it or get a rack mount seat post clamp or improvise. The mounting bar was in the way of the brakes. Crisscrossing the arms gave the V-brakes the room it needs to work properly and now all is good. 2017 Cannondale C4
customer_reviews.author: Martin H

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but works
customer_reviews.text: I find this to be expensive but it is really hefty and heavy duty. Works well with the accompanying brand and I have never been concerned it would fall off or anything of that nature. It does make the bike that much weightier when you put the attached bag on it but its manageable.
customer_reviews.author: djdandylion

customer_reviews.title: A nice solid bike rack
customer_reviews.text: I got this rack almost entirely as an attachment point for panniers, and that's the only way I have used it to date. So it might be inadequate for carrying things on the rack held in place by the spring, but I'd be pretty surprised if that were so. Installation was relatively straightforward and typical of rear racks, a bit fiddly when installing the bars that come forwards to the frame but nothing too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Leon E. Stauffer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: It took me a while to decide to order this rack. I liked the heavy load capacity and the additional struts that you can hook things to & stabilize panniers should you use them. Researching racks led me to believe I had to order a special size rack to accomodate the disc brakes on my Sirrus Elite. A previous review said this rack should fit and it went on without any fuss or modification. The supplied hardware is top rate. A month after installation I sawed off the extra length of steel on the top mounting brackets and it looks fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent rack, needs extra mounting hardware for some bikes
customer_reviews.text: This didn't have enough parts to mount directly to a 2012 Diamondback XE (20" frame). I borrowed some mounting brackets and screws from an old bike in order to make it work, and it's still tilted forward a bit, but not enough to interfere with attaching the Topeak bag. Using the Topeak bags with this rack is an unbelievable improvement in the bike-to-work experience. Packing, mounting, dismounting, and carrying the panniers was frequently enough trouble to keep me from riding my bike to work (about 6 miles away), but with this rake and bag (Topeak MTX Trunk Bag EXP Bicycle Trunk Bag with Rigid Molded Panels), it's way easier and more enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: trouble fitting small bike frames
customer_reviews.text: works great but had to have bike shop install it, will have trouble fitting a small frame bike like mine, I'm 5'3' and my bike is a XS size frame. On larger bikes it should work fine. It will require a special mount for small frame bike, I included pics of the special mount. I lost quick release function of my seat, but it is ok since i never adjust it and it will keep it from getting stolen.
customer_reviews.author: mfmayes49

customer_reviews.title: Great Rack
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought the Novara Madrona and wanted to be able carry groceries home. The rack was simple to install. It is solid and works beautifully with the set of Ortlieb Sport-Packer Plus panniers. I bought a rear light to attach to the rack upon the store sales person recommendation, but I just couldn't figure out how to mount it. Rode the bike back to the store and a little modification to the rack & light was done by removing the left side bar of the rack light mount (pliers and rasping the rough edges off) so the light switch is easy to reach. These same racks cost about $50 in the stores, so this is a nice savings.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina L. Dickey

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Some reviews state that they hear a rattling noise when riding but I don't get any of that. Even though this product is only compatible with the topeak bag it keeps it secured.
customer_reviews.author: Alex R.

customer_reviews.title: easy to install, works great
customer_reviews.text: My Giant Boulder SE mountain bike didn't have mounting holes on the seat post, so I bought a "Sunlite seatpost clamp with Rack Mount" to replace my stock seatpost clamp. After that, installation was very easy. This rack gives you several options for easy on/off bags & baskets from Topeak.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S

customer_reviews.title: Excellent rack (but note that the description is incorrect)
customer_reviews.text: NOTE BENE: The description of this rack indicates that it is for bikes with disc brakes. This is incorrect and the picture is, in fact, correct. It is for bikes WITHOUT disc brakes. The rack itself is fantastic...easy to install, sturdy, and the spring works great for just throwing things on the back of the bike and keeping them there for the entire ride. I haven't invested in one of the sliding bags yet so even without that advantage the rack is just great.
customer_reviews.author: james dobbins

customer_reviews.title: Great rack!!
customer_reviews.text: Great fit on my 2020 Trek FX1 disk, excited to get the bag that works with it. Make sure you get the the "disk" rack if you have disk breaks.
customer_reviews.author: mommy M.

customer_reviews.title: This was fine for everywhere else on the frame except for the ...
customer_reviews.text: This bike frame worked very well with some adjustments. The holes in the bike frame here are 5 mm. This was fine for everywhere else on the frame except for the holes that were supposed to attach at the bike's wheel hubs. The holes on the actual bike were 6 mm. I had to buy two 6 mm screws and my husband drilled the bike frame holes a bit bigger. Then, the new 6 mm screws worked beautifully. The frame feels secure and strong after being attached to the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Anna G.

customer_reviews.title: Warning for smaller bikes. Mounting arms may not be long enough.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, but the arms were not long enough. I had to purchase extra long arms to fit which was an unexpected additional $10. Would have been helpful to know that this was not compatible with my bike out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: jmaz6

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy and Strong
customer_reviews.text: I just installed this on my new Sixthreezero 3-speed 26-inch beach cruiser with internal hub shifter. It did require a trip to Home Depot for longer bolts plus nuts to fit through the rack's struts, the rear fender struts, and then through the frame, and grounding clamps to attach the stabilizer bars to the frame under the seat. Once properly attached, the rack feels very strong and secure, and I think it will be exactly what I need!
customer_reviews.author: L. A. Mueller

customer_reviews.title: Very solid bike rack
customer_reviews.text: Very solid bike rack. This is the only bike rack I've used, but I was pleased enough to get a second one for my wife's bike. It has a center rail for mounting compatible accessories, but I find it just as easy to attach things (like a plastic milk crate) using bungee cords. The two metal arms the attach to the upper part of the bike frame have a lot of room for adjustment and should be able to fit most bike frames. For commuting this offers a ton of flexibility for hauling, as it is rated to carry up to 55 lbs - hard to beat for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Mulder

customer_reviews.title: don't waste your money on the ER, just buy 30 cent extension posts
customer_reviews.text: I bought this b/c I have disc brakes... Iron Horse Warrior 3.0. Now this is the fault of iron horse, burying the threaded holes next to a large weld where the rack mounting posts can't fit... so the SQUARE extensions do not fit the ROUND space. I went to ace hardware and bought 1/4" extension posts which in retrospect will work with any bike rack. If you're deciding between the 29ER and the 29E, go with the cheaper one and just by longer screws and extension sleeves at the hardware store.
customer_reviews.author: Field Gear

customer_reviews.title: Simply Unbeatable
customer_reviews.text: I am a pathetic shopper. One reason this rack caught my attention is there are so many reviews written against it, so I figured people must be buying this product. I bought this rack from Amazon and put it on my Barracuda mountain bike. It went on easily and is a sturdy rack. I put two washers on the side with the sprockets so the supplied bolt would not extend past the inside of the frame. I also bought this rack because Topeak makes bags that mate with the rack and they appear to be good quality products as well. For $28 this rack is simply unbeatable; I have looked locally and all over the web.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Rocks

customer_reviews.title: Strong rack
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and price seems on par with other shops if slightly lower. REI pannier snaps right on and holds snug. Works well
customer_reviews.author: chamber

customer_reviews.title: Great rack but don't expect it to work for every bike.
customer_reviews.text: The rack is great but the nuts are pretty cheap and I stripped one while torquing it down. The rear bolts dont fit my frame either. Gotta run to the hardware store to finish the install, which is lame, but the rack is solid for sure and I'll be happy once its mounted on the bike. Better price and quality than the competition from what i've seen.
customer_reviews.author: Ride.hard

customer_reviews.title: Missing Hardware? Call Topeak!
customer_reviews.text: The rack came from Amazon without mounting hardware. Instead of dealing with Amazon, I decided to try Topeak and called the customer service 1-800 number on the tag that came on the rack. They were very helpful. All I had to do was email the receipt and they sent out the missing hardware via US first class mail. I received it in a week. As for the rack itself: It's light, strong and well made and fit my Surley, Karate Monkey fine. It is a little smaller than the other racks I have, but there are very little choices for a 29er rack that fits around disk brakes nowadays.
customer_reviews.author: L. B.

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with this model on my bike, so purchased an identical one for my wife’s new bike. Requires some gentle bending of flat metal struts, but easy enough to do.
customer_reviews.author: Gary W

customer_reviews.title: Great rack
customer_reviews.text: I use it with the trunk bagso i'm able to slide in and out my bag and snap in place to hold. It was pretty easy to install also. Only issue is there is no way to mount a standard rear light to this bike rack. You're forced to buy the topeak rear lightto snap to the bag you purchase. So if you want everything to work the best and how they were all designed to work together you basically have to buy nothing but topeak products.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl

customer_reviews.title: Great rack
customer_reviews.text: Very nice bike rack for the money. A little challenging to install at first but once on, its great. Extra bonus for acting as a mud guard as well. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: A cargo rack that's more specifically designed or more adjustable or one without supports is all that may correctly fit mountain bikes with the lower mounting holes located extra high up on the frame. It don’t quite fit my 27.5" GT mountain bike correctly, it's a couple of inches too tall and needs to set back a little further. It should fit most other bikes better that have the lower mounting holes located close to the rear axle.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory McMillan

customer_reviews.title: Good fit for a Schwinn
customer_reviews.text: Installed this rack on my old Schwinn. My Schwinn has two bottom mounting options, and the lower option allowed the top brackets to align perfectly with the bolts on the center tube. I did not have to bend any brackets to install. Installation took about 15-20 minutes. Planet Bike tail light mount (purchased seperately) aligned perfectly with bracket on rack. I had two options here as well and chose the lower position to keep the tail light out of the way when using the rack. The rack appears quite sturdy and good for my moderate needs as I do not plan on exceeding 20lbs of weight. I've attached photos at "Customer Images".
customer_reviews.author: Merrill D. Giro

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Bike Rack!
customer_reviews.text: Love the Topeak Explorer Bike Rack! Its very easy to install and is totally clear of my rear tire and disc brakes. Looking forward to receiving the snap in accessory pouches. Very well built and light weight. I highly recommend. I have two Cannondale Trail 3 Bikes, a Small frame with 27.5" Wheels and a Medium with 29" wheels and the rack sits perfectly straight and away from the tires.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Espinosa

customer_reviews.title: A great rack
customer_reviews.text: I hate giving reviews to great products that have simple and really annoying flaws. This rack is great. I love it. It works well and it looks good. Here is the really lame part, and this has been reflected in other reviews. They give you the wrong bolts to mount it. This was very annoying as I had to go to a hardware store to get the correct ones. After that it mounted fine. But there is nothing more frustrating then trying to put a new part on your bike and find that the bolt/nut combination provided does not work!
customer_reviews.author: Azathoth

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Light, and Funcional
customer_reviews.text: I love the Topeak QuickTrack system. I have two bags of different sizes, one for commuting to work, and one for recreational trips. This rack, in conjuction with the bags, is a very sturdy and convient way to carry what I need for the day. I'm not sure this is the best rack for the money if you don't buy into the whole system, but buying into the whole system is exactly what I would recommend. It is not cheap, but the convience and security has made me a fan of Topeak products. I just bought a second rack to mount on my latest bike. Other than normal wear from years of use, my old rack is going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Convert

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sturdy rack
customer_reviews.text: Almost the perfect rack for my needs, works great with the topeak bag, if you are interested in this take a look to the tourist model, I'm my case I think that was the perfect rack for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great Topeak rack!
customer_reviews.text: No issues and fit perfectly on my Giant Talon 2 29er. I didn't buy the optional longer silver attachment bars. I simply installed 2 of the 4 bolts supplied and works great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice rack !
customer_reviews.text: Love this rack ! It looks great, very well made and was easy to install. But I do wish Topeak would finish the front support brackets to match the rack rather than the Crome. Looks ok, but would look better if they matched the rack.
customer_reviews.author: Steve R

customer_reviews.title: 1. On the paper note on the side it ...
customer_reviews.text: 1. On the paper note on the side it says "For 26'', 27.5'' and 700C wheels". meaning it is not for 24 inches wheel. 2. The paper note on top of the rack says "NOT FOR USE WITH CHILD SEAT". I don't know why amazon listed it as "Buy it together" when I purchase the bike seat.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This rack was so easy to attach to my bike. I am so pleased with the quality. I use it daily for my commute and use an Ortlieb bag on it. It is super sturdy and the thickness of the rack itself makes it hard to destroy. I am very hard on my cycling gear and this has definitely survived some harsh conditions.
customer_reviews.author: M. Charette

customer_reviews.title: Nice rack, if you can get it to fit.
customer_reviews.text: I like the rack, but still haven't found a good way to attach the front struts to my Diamondback Insight. The straps seem to run a afoul of my rear brake however I try and bend them. These straps are also the weak point of the product and look cheesy compared to the rack. I got some Bontrager struts and am working on them to adapt and fit my bike.
customer_reviews.author: S. Brightman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Bike Rack for Large Mountain Bikes
customer_reviews.text: Rack fit perfectly on my 29er Gary Fisher mountain bike. This is a huge bike, and most racks will *NOT* fit. Rack was easy to install. I also bought a Sunlite Adapter to connect the rack to my seat mast. This may not be needed by everyone, but was a real plus to my installation as my bike does not have any built-in connection points. I have installed saddle bags, and the rack places the bags out of the way so that nothing interferes with pedaling. Rack is very sturdy, and I believe could hold more than the rated weight if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Russell D.

product_meta.title: Topeak Explorer Rack
product_meta.description: Topeak Explorer Rear Mount Rack features an integrated top plate for quick-mount Topeak MTX and RX Quick Track trunk bags. Features: Size (LxWxH): 13.4" x 5.6" x 16.3" One size fits all frames Tough 6061 T6 aluminum construction with 6061 T6 aluminum fitting bracket Hollow tube O/D 10.2mm Integrated top plate for quick-mount Topeak MTX and RX Quick Track trunk bags Integrated fender top
feature_bullets: Solid Fender Top, RedLite Mount, Tail Light Mount
